title: Cryptography
ziele:
Students acquire sound knowledge of cryptographic methods on data and communication security.
The course explores current cryptographic concepts, algorithms, protocols and systems found in information security in depth.
lehrinhalte:
Base concepts of cryptography; symmetric block ciphers (DES, 3DES, IDEA, Skipjack, AES); symmetric stream ciphers (shift registers, RC4, Seal, A5); asymmetric cryptosystems (Diffie-Helmann, ElGamal, RSA); digital signatures (certificates, DSA, RSA); cryptographic hash functions (SHA-3); elliptic curve cryptography; applications and protocols (PGP, SSL/TLS, SET, 3D Secure).

Project: students have to choose, analyze, and document (in groups) either a practical system where cryptography is applied, or advanced theoretical aspects of cryptography that can not be treated in depth in the lecture due to time constraints.
beurteilung: Written exam at the end of the semester; realization, presentation and documentation of (small) project.
literatur:
PDF-versions of the slides used in the lecture will be made available via KUSSS.

Recommended reading: Bruce Schneier (2006). Angewandte Kryptographie. Person Studium.
